revised_title: On Flows and Fronts in a Stratified Fluid: A Study of Characteristics and Operators
tldr: This article presents a study of one-dimensional flows in a stratified fluid, focusing on the behavior of characteristics and the application of the method of characteristics. The authors develop a theory for stratified fluid flow, using operators based on properties of characteristic lines, which can be translated into programs for machine computation. They derive a complete solution for a two-layer system and discuss front formation and transition within the system, identifying two distinct types of fluid fronts.
